instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H_RTC: What is PP3V3_G3H_RTC? PP3V3_G3H_RTC Is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..

threads.title: 01949 No Power
threads.message:
Am struggling a little today with this board and need some clearheaded suggestions; had a couple in a row and can't think straight:)

Board might have had some work done on it, but i think i spotted all the mistakes (some coils of PMIC were taken off, but so far i don't know why, nothing else seemed missing.)
all USBC ports draw 5V steady and seem to have all their LDOs out of the port controllers.

PPBus was cycling quickly from 0 to 12.3V, along with <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> constantly trying to come up with some voltage (too quick to read)
I first removed <RESISTOR>R9707</RESISTOR>: Enable for <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> was cycling as well, so i took it off and then PPBUS Stabilizes to 12.3V
I then thought my <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> was bad (also because it looked to be cycling up to 2.7V and not to 3.3V, which is odd), diode-mode on <CAPACITOR>C6912</CAPACITOR> was reading just a little low as well so i replaced <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> (for the second time), and put back <RESISTOR>R9707</RESISTOR>:
Now output at <CAPACITOR>C6912</CAPACITOR> is again cycling from 0 - 2.7V, as well as PPBUS cycling again.

i took off <RESISTOR>R6934</RESISTOR>/35 to see if there was a difference, and when these fuses are off, i get steady 3.3V at <CAPACITOR>C6912</CAPACITOR>.
I then thought, there must be a short after <RESISTOR>R6934</RESISTOR>/35 on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>, but i cant find it, diode mode is OK at around .380

any idea what is causing this, or am i missing some steps?
Thanks in advance!

threads.title: 01949 No Power
threads.message:
You may have short, or overcurrent on a secondary power supply.
Need to change all circuits from pages 54-64...

threads.title: 01949 No Power
threads.message:
Found a short on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL> Inside the <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> chip (tested with multimeter on its pins)..
I don't have a donor board for this unfortunately, are any other boards' calpe chips compatible?

threads.title: 01949 No Power
threads.message: Yeah, the PMIC should from other model.
